about.name: Alexandria
about.info_text: Alexandria, known as 'The Pearl of the Mediterranean,' is a historic and vibrant city located on the northern coast of Egypt. It boasts a rich blend of ancient history, Mediterranean beauty, and modern charm. With its stunning coastal views, archaeological wonders, and a lively cultural scene, Alexandria is a captivating destination. Visitors can explore its ancient ruins, enjoy the beautiful beaches, and savor the city's unique blend of Egyptian and Mediterranean cuisine.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 5.2 million
Governorate: Alexandria
Time Zone: Eastern European Time (UTC+02:00)
Language: Arabic
Currency: Egyptian Pound (EGP)
about.climate_text: Alexandria has a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. The city enjoys a pleasant sea breeze, making it an attractive destination year-round.

attractions_card.title: Qaitbay Citadel
attractions_card.description: The Qaitbay Citadel is a historic fortress located on the Mediterranean coast. It offers panoramic views of the sea and houses a maritime museum, providing insight into Alexandria's maritime history.

attractions_card.title: Bibliotheca Alexandrina
attractions_card.description: The Bibliotheca Alexandrina is a modern library and cultural center that pays homage to the ancient Library of Alexandria. It hosts a vast collection of books, exhibitions, and cultural events.

attractions_card.title: Montaza Palace
attractions_card.description: Montaza Palace is a royal palace complex surrounded by lush gardens. It offers a glimpse into the history of Egypt's monarchy and is a picturesque spot for a leisurely stroll.

attractions_card.title: Pompey's Pillar
attractions_card.description: Pompey's Pillar is a monolithic column rising from the ruins of the ancient Serapeum temple. It's a significant historical landmark in Alexandria.

attractions_card.title: Stanley Bridge
attractions_card.description: The Stanley Bridge is a picturesque bridge connecting the city to the Montaza district. It offers scenic views and is a popular spot for a relaxing walk.

attractions_card.title: Alexandria Corniche
attractions_card.description: The Alexandria Corniche is a scenic promenade along the Mediterranean coast, where visitors can enjoy sea views, dine at waterfront restaurants, and soak in the city's atmosphere.

attractions_card.title: Catacombs of Kom El Shoqafa
attractions_card.description: The Catacombs of Kom El Shoqafa are an underground burial site dating back to the Roman period. They feature a fascinating mix of Egyptian, Greek, and Roman art and architecture.

food_card.title: Koshary
food_card.description: Koshary is a traditional Egyptian dish made with pasta, rice, lentils, and a flavorful tomato sauce, topped with fried onions and chickpeas.

food_card.title: Seafood Platter
food_card.description: Given its coastal location, Alexandria is renowned for its fresh seafood. Visitors can savor a delightful seafood platter featuring grilled or fried fish, shrimp, and more.

food_card.title: Ful Medames
food_card.description: Ful Medames is a classic Egyptian breakfast dish made from slow-cooked fava beans, typically seasoned with olive oil, garlic, and spices.

food_card.title: Egyptian Shawarma
food_card.description: Egyptian shawarma features marinated and roasted meat, often served in flatbread with tahini sauce, vegetables, and pickles.

food_card.title: Baklava
food_card.description: Baklava is a sweet and flaky pastry made of layers of filo dough, nuts, and honey or syrup, creating a delightful dessert.

hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Hotel Alexandria
hotels_card.description: The Four Seasons Hotel offers luxury and elegance with views of the Mediterranean, a private beach, and exceptional amenities.

hotels_card.title: Helnan Palestine Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Helnan Palestine Hotel is a historic and grand hotel overlooking the Montaza Royal Gardens and the Mediterranean Sea.

hotels_card.title: Hilton Alexandria Corniche
hotels_card.description: The Hilton on the Corniche offers modern comfort and stunning sea views, making it a great choice for travelers.

hotels_card.title: Steigenberger Cecil Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Steigenberger Cecil is a historic hotel with a prime location, combining old-world charm with modern amenities.

hotels_card.title: Tolip Hotel Alexandria
hotels_card.description: Tolip Hotel provides a contemporary and comfortable stay, close to popular attractions and the Mediterranean coast.

transport_card.title: Alexandria Tram
transport_card.description: The Alexandria Tram is a convenient way to explore the city, with routes connecting various districts and landmarks.

transport_card.title: Alexandria Bus Services
transport_card.description: Public buses are available for transportation within the city, offering an affordable way to get around.

transport_card.title: Alexandria Port
transport_card.description: The Port of Alexandria is a major seaport and a gateway for maritime transportation to and from the city.

transport_card.title: Borg El Arab International Airport
transport_card.description: Borg El Arab International Airport (HBE) is the primary airport serving Alexandria, connecting it to domestic and international destinations.
